title: Gabriel Hernández and BDO Puerto Rico

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to a criminal indictment from 2020, the IRS led an investigation that eventually led to Gabriel F. Hernández being indicted for ten counts of wire fraud: https://www.courtlistener.com/docket/18561953/3/united-states-v-hernandez/

Therefore, I am requesting the following information:

1) All instructional materials, presentations, and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance on investigations into Gabriel Hernández (also known as Gabriel F. Hernández) and BDO Puerto Rico. This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that discussed investigations into Hernández and BDO Puerto Rico, B) any any explanations (whether internally or externally generated) of why the IRS was investigating Hernández or BDO Puerto Rico, and C) any other document that has been used to help explain the investigation into Hernández and BDO Puerto Rico.

2) A copy of any after-action reports, executive summaries, assessments , contracts, memos, directives and their associated attatchments direct IRS employees to investigate Hernández and BDO Puerto Rico. 

3) Any digital communications including but not limited to emails and text messages) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) that mention Gabriel Hernández or BDO Puerto Rico.

4) Any case reports that mention Gabriel Hernández or BDO Puerto Rico

5) Any physical letters or digital communications exchanged with Gabriel Hernández or BDO Puerto Rico.

6) Any physical letters or digital communications exchanged with Department of Economic Development and Commerce (DDEC) and the Puerto Rico Department of Treasury (Hacienda) that mention Gabriel Hernández or BDO Puerto Rico

To aid in your search, please use the following keywords when conducting a search for responsive documents.
"Puerto Rico"
"Act 20"
"Act 60"
"Act 22"
"tax break"
"individual resident investor"
"puerto rico trust strategy"
"promoter"
"decree holders"
"Gabriel Hernández"
"BDO"
"UCA-taxpayer"
"Export services act"
"individual investors act"
"sham transactions"
"fraudulent act 20"
"fraudulent act 22"
"office of industrial tax exemptions"
"DDEC"

Please try to include any miscellaneous documents that could explain the investigation into Hernández and/or BDO Puerto Rico. This request is for all records produced between Jan 1, 2017 and the time this request is processed. When records are made available, please send them to me on a rolling basis.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. Any documents responsive to this request will be used in the course of reporting about investigations into Puerto Rico's tax breaks for Heavy Weather, an independent newsletter about Puerto Rico. heavyweather.media

I ask that this request be given expedited processing and be placed on the simple track given the relative simplicity of the request and the short time span in which the requested records would have been produced.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

title: White House letter to Smithsonian re: “Restoring Truth and Sanity to American History"

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the August 12, 2025, letter to Lonnie Bunch, the secretary of the Smithsonian Institution, from Lindsey Halligan (White House senior associate), Vince Haley (director of the domestic policy council), and Russ Vought (director of OMB). The letter is referenced by the Wall Street Journal report here: https://www.wsj.com/politics/policy/white-house-to-vet-smithsonian-museums-to-fit-trumps-historical-vision-78875c8a?mod=hp_lead_pos8

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh
